page.title: 04Smarden West - Sheep
page.content: You cannot travel very far in this area without seeing sheep. For them the small fields and heavy clay land are ideal and they have taken over as the main livestock enterprise; many people with a small paddock or orchard have a few sheep to keep down the grass and provide a satisfying hobby. For the serious, sometimes part-time, farmer, however, it is hard work. Foot-care, worming and vaccinating routines can fit in between jobs. Hay-making, shearing and twice yearly dipping are often done by contractors. Lambing is the hardest time. The shepherd has to be extra-vigilant; prolific lambing in close proximity can cause confusion and lambs not correctly matched with mothers must be bottle-fed if rejected. However, when the sheep and lambs turn on to the spring fields it is well worth while.
